body: The Ruqqus admins have day jobs. I don't think there's resistance to adding it, but there are other things being worked on at the minute, and being yelled at and called slurs isn't going to make them drop everything they're doing and add it immediately. Xibar86 agreed to the ToS when making an account. He can either wait for the update to add this feature or get over it.

body:
I think it is deleted, I'm assuming the user page is checking if the account is banned before checking for deletion. You *used* to not be able to delete a suspended account due to a bug, [but it was fixed recently](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/pull/589/files#diff-3909581a33b19307746062eaad4e836b97d9ce160fd01e6af2fea5c29bd7e105L379).

However the bug where you can't see your own profile remains.

Edit: the bug is back for some reason, along with another one where you can't delete your account without ruqqus premium.
body_html:
I think it is deleted, I'm assuming the user page is checking if the account is banned before checking for deletion. You used to not be able to delete a suspended account due to a bug, but it was fixed recently.

Edit: the bug is back for some reason, along with another one where you can't delete your account without ruqqus premium.

body:
It's like this:

1. Create an account
2. Log in from another browser/device
3. Delete the account
4. Continue posting where it's still logged in

  2. Log in from another browser/device

body:
I also tried logging in to a deleted account at first. It didn't work. Then I realized that you can be logged in to the same account on multiple devices/browsers. So I tried creating an account, logging in elsewhere, deleting the account, and continuing to post where it's still logged in.

Also, I myself am sfrohne (but this is a different account, Account_Deleted).

body: Two problems with that. One, if it's not my preferred category then what the fuck is even the point? Two, they all fail me. I impress most people currently but that's just because they've never done anything in their life. Every single thing I've ever done, I learn some information but make little progress anywhere. And that's just how it is, I think it's possible to be talented in one area but usually you're just either smart or you're not, creative or you're not, good at socializing or you're not, etc. People like sfrohne immediately excel to impossible levels in every aspect and others like me are stuck at a mediocre level in everything. Genetics isn't worried about being fair, it's worried about what roles in society your ancestors worked and if yours didn't need as many capabilities to accomplish then tough luck, that's what you're stuck with. In my case, I'm guessing most of the men in my lineage were laborers or servants, or something that doesn't need any sophisticated ability to do, just day in and day out, repeat the same process. Because believe me I'm "smart" but I have nothing, nor does anyone I know of in my family. They're the kind that just goes to work every day, comes home and doesn't do much else. They talk or watch the boring tv or sleep and that's about it, and on special occasions do little more than have a beer and chit chat about pointless topics. Basically Homer Simpson. And there's nothing wrong with that, except for the fact that I'm not into that but that's the only skillset I have. While anyone talented could easily do that too, but I can't the other way around. Caste systems are evil and that's exactly how genetics works.

In my case, I'm guessing most of the men in my lineage were laborers or servants, or something that doesn't need any sophisticated ability to do, just day in and day out, repeat the same process. Because believe me I'm "smart" but I have nothing, nor does anyone I know of in my family. They're the kind that just goes to work every day, comes home and doesn't do much else. They talk or watch the boring tv or sleep and that's about it, and on special occasions do little more than have a beer and chit chat about pointless topics. Basically Homer Simpson. And there's nothing wrong with that, except for the fact that I'm not into that but that's the only skillset I have. While anyone talented could easily do that too, but I can't the other way around. Caste systems are evil and that's exactly how genetics works.

parent.body: You know, National Socialism outlawed defeatism and promoted people based on their strengths. Perhaps you could benefit from pursuing another hobbie or skill based on your talents, even if it's not your preferred category. This one appears to be failing you.

body:
You seem to be towing someone else's rope. I wanted to be a pilot most of my life, but my mom always said I was too against the grain and would be a better investigator. I disagreed, I had zero interest in it. But, flying is expensive as fuck. Research is often free. I dabbled in a bit just for fun, and once I discovered I had a knack for it, it became more interesting. I was once in a training class for work and was classified as "independent thinker" in which I didn't give a shit what the mainstream says, I arrived at my own conclusions based on my own research. They said that's actually rare, but "many of life's greatest leaders belonged to this group". 

Lineage doesn't mean shit when you beat your own path. My ancestors were drivers, loggers, general maintenance, etc. But, that was then and this is now, the circumstances change. You seem like you're trying to be something you're not. I was a musician once, in a band that kinda sucked. But, I didn't give a shit because it was fun. I didn't get discouraged just because others did better. I embraced competition, it helped shape and build my own style. 

You have skills you aren't even aware of yet.
body_html:
You seem to be towing someone else's rope. I wanted to be a pilot most of my life, but my mom always said I was too against the grain and would be a better investigator. I disagreed, I had zero interest in it. But, flying is expensive as fuck. Research is often free. I dabbled in a bit just for fun, and once I discovered I had a knack for it, it became more interesting. I was once in a training class for work and was classified as "independent thinker" in which I didn't give a shit what the mainstream says, I arrived at my own conclusions based on my own research. They said that's actually rare, but "many of life's greatest leaders belonged to this group".

Lineage doesn't mean shit when you beat your own path. My ancestors were drivers, loggers, general maintenance, etc. But, that was then and this is now, the circumstances change. You seem like you're trying to be something you're not. I was a musician once, in a band that kinda sucked. But, I didn't give a shit because it was fun. I didn't get discouraged just because others did better. I embraced competition, it helped shape and build my own style.

You have skills you aren't even aware of yet.

body:
The problem is most of my interests depend on actually producing something, and I'm missing out on half the fun which is the result. This isn't someone else's rope, they were my interests from the beginning. They just happen to be very similar to sfrohne's. I have ASD which may be partially why I don't align with my biologically determined talents, as the rest of my family is perfectly content with it. I would think that normally you would be driven to do what you're made for, that only makes sense. But I'm stuck either trying to be someone I'm not and failing, or being whatever it is that I am and hating it.

Also you're thinking too recent in terms of lineage. You aren't made for a specific thing, you adapt to certain categories, and most of it would go back to ancient times; just because your family chose less skilled careers recently doesn't mean it was always so, as talented and smart people can do unskilled tasks but not the other way around. In ancient times, some people are servants, others are kings, others are generals, others are businessmen, etc. and they adapted to the talents for their skillset. Generally men were more labor and rationally oriented as well while women got better at creative abilities and more naturally intelligent, and this is also reflected in modern days. Unfortunately genetics are not fair, they're strictly utilitarian, and if you don't like what you're built for you're in trouble. Some types of people (like laborers or nonskilled servants) didn't really need any talents while others (like the elite and high class people) needed every talent they could get.
body_html:
The problem is most of my interests depend on actually producing something, and I'm missing out on half the fun which is the result. This isn't someone else's rope, they were my interests from the beginning. They just happen to be very similar to sfrohne's. I have ASD which may be partially why I don't align with my biologically determined talents, as the rest of my family is perfectly content with it. I would think that normally you would be driven to do what you're made for, that only makes sense. But I'm stuck either trying to be someone I'm not and failing, or being whatever it is that I am and hating it.

Also you're thinking too recent in terms of lineage. You aren't made for a specific thing, you adapt to certain categories, and most of it would go back to ancient times; just because your family chose less skilled careers recently doesn't mean it was always so, as talented and smart people can do unskilled tasks but not the other way around. In ancient times, some people are servants, others are kings, others are generals, others are businessmen, etc. and they adapted to the talents for their skillset. Generally men were more labor and rationally oriented as well while women got better at creative abilities and more naturally intelligent, and this is also reflected in modern days. Unfortunately genetics are not fair, they're strictly utilitarian, and if you don't like what you're built for you're in trouble. Some types of people (like laborers or nonskilled servants) didn't really need any talents while others (like the elite and high class people) needed every talent they could get.

parent.body:
You seem to be towing someone else's rope. I wanted to be a pilot most of my life, but my mom always said I was too against the grain and would be a better investigator. I disagreed, I had zero interest in it. But, flying is expensive as fuck. Research is often free. I dabbled in a bit just for fun, and once I discovered I had a knack for it, it became more interesting. I was once in a training class for work and was classified as "independent thinker" in which I didn't give a shit what the mainstream says, I arrived at my own conclusions based on my own research. They said that's actually rare, but "many of life's greatest leaders belonged to this group". 

Lineage doesn't mean shit when you beat your own path. My ancestors were drivers, loggers, general maintenance, etc. But, that was then and this is now, the circumstances change. You seem like you're trying to be something you're not. I was a musician once, in a band that kinda sucked. But, I didn't give a shit because it was fun. I didn't get discouraged just because others did better. I embraced competition, it helped shape and build my own style. 

You have skills you aren't even aware of yet.
